containerConfig.description: container for the sample multiple choice question

choices.content: Hydroelectric power provides energy to meet the base demand, solar energy is used during the day, and wind is used when available.
Hydroelectric power provides energy to meet the base demand, solar energy is used to meet peak demand during the day, and wind energy is used at night.
Solar power provides energy to meet the base demand, hydroelectric power is used to meet peak demand during the day, and wind is used when it is available.
Wind energy provides energy to meet the base demand, solar energy is used to meet peak demand during the day, and hydroelectric power is used when available.

config.question: Which of the following combinations of energy could provide a 100% renewable energy mix?  Base demand refers to the demand that is always present for power (24 hours a day.  Peak demand refers to the period of the day when the most energy is used – usually in the afternoon when many people are at work.

answer3.response: Does solar provide a consistent-enough source of energy to meet the base demand? Which of the sources mentioned here is almost always available and would thus serve as a good base demand option?

answer1.response: Can solar energy be used “during the day” in general?  What about cloudy days? Think about what specific time and type of demand solar would be best for.

answer4.response: Does wind provide a consistent-enough source of energy to meet the base demand?  Which of the sources mentioned here is almost always available and would thus serve as a good base demand option?
